message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.IR, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the implementation of conversational agents in the recruitment domain, which falls under the natural language processing (NLP) field. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of machine learning (ML) systems, which suggests that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another likely sub-category. The challenges in understanding and resolving errors in the system involve user experience (UX), which falls under cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The paper also mentions the exposure of ML data to recruiter teams, which suggests the involvement of information retrieval (IR) techniques, making cs.IR a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the challenges in sustained maintenance of the system, which involves the use of ML-based mediating systems, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category.
